attributes.title: Hasbro Set For Sustained Top-Line Growth
summary: Hasbro posted decent fiscal first-quarter results helped by strong demand for its Franchise Brands.
Jurassic World’s incredibly strong box-office performance across the world should result in stronger-than-expected shipments of its namesake brand of toys.
Looking forward, revenue growth is expected to be in an upward trajectory as significant releases are lined-up this year that have licensing agreements with Hasbro.

attributes.content:
Apart from Comcast (CMCSA), one more company which must be rejoicing Jurassic World's overwhelming success at the box-office across the world is Hasbro (NASDAQ:HAS). Hasbro, which has the license for selling and marketing toys based on the Jurassic World brand, recorded robust shipments of Jurassic World brand of toys even before the movie hit the theaters in the fiscal first-quarter.

Now, with the movie grossing record collections, it won't be a surprise that Hasbro's Jurassic World brand toys' shipments surpass the toy maker's own estimation in following quarters. Moreover, fiscal first quarters are traditionally low-revenue quarters for Hasbro, so shipments should pick-up pace going forward.

Last year as well Hasbro's shipments benefited from the release of two significant motion pictures during the summer months: The Amazing Spider Man 2 and Transformers: Age of Extinction.

In the current fiscal year, Hasbro already has been to a decent start. It reported 5% growth in revenue driven by 20% revenue growth in its Franchise Brands, even as adjusted earnings jumped 43%, year-over-year.

Looking ahead, I think the company will continue to see revenue growth moving in an upward trajectory as it is in a position to capitalize on the positive momentum in its brands.

As I discussed earlier, as a part of its brand-building strategy, Hasbro has developed a comprehensive brand blueprint. This brand blueprint, which focuses on understanding consumer and audience insight, enables it to quickly adapt to changes in the market. Robust shipments of its Franchise brands prove Hasbro's effective brand-building strategy is yielding results.

Additionally, the toymaker is also expected to benefit from a few more significant releases lined-up this year that are spread across the broader period of a time unlike last year when releases were timed during the summer.
